post_text: All SCS schools & offices are OPEN today (11/12). Please dress warmly & be safe heading to work today. Have a great day!
text: All SCS schools & offices are OPEN today (11/12). Please dress warmly & be safe heading to work today. Have a great day!

post_text:
We are aware of the forecast and will be working closely with the National Weather Service to monitor conditions throughout the night and early morning hours before the start of the school day. Safety is our top priority, so we will be taking all factors into consideration as we work to make any decisions that impact schools. This includes road conditions, as well as conditions on campus and in our school communities. A loss of instructional time is never ideal, but we will always put safety first.

We expect to make a final decision no later than 5:30 a.m. and will share this information via text, social media, on our website and on 88.5FM.

As we look ahead to the rest of the week, please make sure students are dressed warm as they head to the bus stop or walk to school every day. Dressing in layers will help stay warm during the cold mornings, but layers can be easily taken off if temperatures get warmer in the afternoon.

As we look ahead to the rest of the week, please make sure students are dressed warm as they head to the bus stop or walk to school every day. Dressing in layers will help stay warm during the cold mornings, but layers can be easily taken off if temperatures get warmer in the afternoon.

post_text:
Today, the Shelby County Health Department announced that they will be partnering with the SCS to provide free lead testing for all students at the schools that tested positive. We know this has been a concern for families, so we are very appreciative that the health department will make testing available for FREE. Testing is available during normal Shelby County Health Department hours at all of their local clinics. No appointment or proof of health insurance is required, but a parent or legal guardian must accompany the child. For more information about lead and lead screening and testing, please visit the Shelby County Health Department website -- www.shelbytnhealth.com -- or call 901-222-9000.

Read more - http://www.scsk12.org/newsroom/#/article/1072

Join our Chief Academic Officer Dr. Antonio Burt for this momentous occasion! #Commit2Literacy

Teacher resources available at http://www.scsk12.org/earlyliteracy//activities?PID=1528

post_text:
SCS is committed to sticking with our students and supporting them with the Social-Emotional resources they need to stay on track. Earlier, this year, G.W. Carver College and Career Academy - SCS cut the ribbon on it's new Pursuit Center to provide guidance outside of a normal classroom setting. The Pursuit Center contains innovative tools such as 3D printers, simulators, and touch screens. There’s also a video game room and a fitness center.

The product of a partnership with the DEA, Shelby County Mayor Lee Harris, and juvenile court. Students and staff work on such topics as academics, positive relationships, social/emotional skills, and career readiness.

“If we can really pour into them, intensive resources and intensive programming, the goal is you put them on the path of rehabilitation and at least as importantly, you reduce youth crime.” - Mayor Lee Harris

#SCSis901

It's time to reimagine the way we deliver education. To strengthen our schools and communities, we are rethinking the way we align resources to provide our children with the highest quality learning environments, strongest social-emotional supports, and most effective academic experiences. We must knock down the barriers to excellence and transform our District.

Please join us for our Reimagining 901 community meetings, starting next week! #SCSis901

Thursday, Nov. 7 - Trezevant High School, 5:30 - 7 PM
Saturday, Nov. 23 - SCS Teaching and Learning Academy (2485 Union Ave), 10 - 11:30 AM

post_text:
SCS is making some of the most impressive progress of any large urban public school district in America, according to the 2019 National Assessment of Educational Progress (NAEP) – also known as the Nation’s Report Card.

NAEP measures performance in fourth and eighth grade Reading and Math across various demographic subgroups. SCS is one of only two districts in the nation, along with Washington D.C. Public Schools, to show numerical academic growth for both subjects in both grades!

Read more and see the full report card - http://www.scsk12.org/newsroom/#/article/1060

post_text:
We are proud to officially welcome 4 new Cabinet Members today to our SCS Team! Our new additions are:

- Yolanda Martin as SCS Chief of Human Resources
- Genard Phillips as Chief of Business Operations
- Lakshmi Visvanathan as Chief Information Officer
- Tutonial Williams as Chief Finance Officer (formerly interim).

These new cabinet members will serve integral roles in implementing the ambitious goals set out in the Seven Next Steps Toward Destination 2025

Learn more: http://www.scsk12.org/newsroom/#/article/1059

“Martin, Phillips, Visvanathan, and Williams are all consummate professionals who will undoubtedly move the needle for Shelby County Schools as we seek to implement academic equity. I’m building a team of innovators who must be bold and courageous in ensuring operational effectiveness in the District. These servant leaders are ready for the next challenge and will be instrumental in the alignment of resources and building culture at SCS.” - Superintendent Dr. Joris M. Ray #SCSis901

post_text: To close out #NationalPrincipalsMonth, we want to share our final #SecuretheChalk Spotlight for this round. Assistant Principal Hardaway of Cordova High School works hard to ensure that his students feel like part of "one big, happy family." Through his open-door office policy and support of robust extracurricular opportunities, Mr. Hardaway keeps his Wolves emotionally supported and engaged in their school community. He is an outstanding example of how arts education can be a pathway out of poverty, and we are honored that he chooses SCS. #SCSis901 #SecuretheChalk #SCSArtsMatter

This Monday, Memphis experienced a violent storm that suddenly displaced many of the families that attend Parkway Village Elementary - SCS. Our caring teachers were offsetting needs by purchasing necessities for these families on their own, and we want to offer support. We are asking for your help in getting these families back on their feet during this difficult time.

If your family has been affected and you are in need of assistance, The Red Cross and multiple state agencies will also be at Olivet Fellowship Baptist Church, 4450 Knight Arnold Road, Friday (10am-6pm) and Saturday (10pm-2pm).

Co-written by real New York high school students, the play examines important issues such as mental health and friendship in urban high schools. We can't wait to see it! post_text:
Safety is our top priority, and threats of any kind are always taken seriously and fully investigated by SCS Security and the appropriate law enforcement agencies. Threats – real or fake – are highly disruptive, and students must understand there are serious consequences for making threats, including possible criminal charges.

First and foremost, threats disrupt learning. Furthermore, threats also take officers away from their important work of protecting schools and communities and cause unnecessary panic and stress for families and other students. We need families to help us emphasize the seriousness of making threats and using social media responsibly. Threats of any kind will not be tolerated in our schools - verbal, online or written.

Be assured, if there is ever a credible threat involving one of our schools, families will always be informed and we will take every possible precaution to protect our schools. Thank you for your help in keeping our schools safe and focused on education!

post_text:
In honor of National Unity Day, we are standing together with our schools, staff, local and national law enforcement, and the entire 901 community to show our commitment to safe and disturbance-free learning environment. Bullying and threats will not be tolerated, and will be fully investigated as we work to address the roots of these issues. Supporting student social and emotional needs is a top District priority, and our team of counselors and psychologists is available to all students.

We ask our SCS families to stand with us against bullying and threats, and please report any occurrences to help keep our students and teachers safe and focused on education. #SCSis901 #UnityDay2019 🧡

Our next half-day is Friday, November 8 - don't forget to apply on Powerschool for the Half-Day Program! The application opens this Thursday, Oct. 24, at 9 AM and closes next Thursday, Oct. 31 at 5 PM.

In an effort to provide learning activities for students during this year’s scheduled half-days, SCS has developed a new Half-Day Program. The program is available at all SCS-managed schools and will be held on all eight of the scheduled half-days. It operates between each school’s half-day dismissal time and the normal dismissal time, providing extended enrichment for students and options for families who may not have available childcare for those afternoons.

Visit www.scsk12.org/halfday for more information.

post_text:
SCHOOL POWER OUTAGE UPDATE:

As the District continues to monitor weather conditions and power outages, we err on the side of caution and safety for our students. The average temperature is 65 degrees and there is natural light in most classrooms. If neighborhood schools are without power, we know homes in the community likely do not have power. Rather than dismissing early in the rain and risking students arriving to homes in the dark, we will keep students safe and supervised at school where they will be provided with nutritious meals. If there are changes to this plan, we will communicate developments throughout the day.
text:
SCHOOL POWER OUTAGE UPDATE:

As the District continues to monitor weather conditions and power outages, we err on the side of caution and safety for our students. The average temperature is 65 degrees and there is natural light in most classrooms. If neighborhood schools are without power, we know homes in the community likely do not have power. Rather than dismissing early in the rain and risking students arriving to homes in the dark, we will keep students safe and supervised at school where they will be provided with nutritious meals. If there are changes to this plan, we will communicate developments throughout the day.

post_text: WEATHER UPDATE: Parents, please use caution as you transport students to school. Our buses are already on the road, and many students are en route for schools. The District is monitoring the weather conditions. Principals are implement severe weather procedures as students arrive on campus this morning, and no students will be marked tardy if they arrive late due to the weather conditions. We are also aware of some power outages in the area and will share additional messaging as soon as we learn more.

post_text:
October is home to #WorldMentalHealthDay, and we want highlight one of many social workers who works tirelessly to support our SCS Family: your 2019 TN School Social Worker of the Year, Brenda Eckles!

She was selected by the Tennessee Association of School Social Workers for her outstanding dedication and the impact she has had on students and their families, schools, and communities. As we continue to focus on cultivating Social Emotional Learning (SEL) skills in our students, social workers like Brenda are invaluable in empowering our young scholars.

We are so grateful to have the best of the best working in our system daily. Thank you and congratulations! 💖🏆

post_text:
One of the best ways to ensure your student is successful on the ACT is to enroll them in fine arts classes. Fine arts students on average score two points higher on their ACT than those that don't.

We've got a new SCSArtsMatter video out for October featuring Poplar Pike Playhouse at Germantown High School's Creative and Performing Arts Program. Check it out at scsartsmatter.org.

post_text:
Research suggests that people often see black boys through negative lenses — and that boys can suffer the consequences. We’re committed to changing the trajectory for our African-American Males and all of our students through education, and we are proud to announce we partnering with Peer Power for the ACT Prep University! We encourage our future ACT test takers to sign up and gain an edge. One point can make all the difference! 📈

Register now at www.regpacks.com/actprepoct24

#OurBoysNeedUs

post_text: To celebrate #NationalPrincipalsMonth and the work we are doing to honor our African American Male educators, we want to recognize Principal Humphrey at Idlewild Elementary, who is an equity champion in all he does. He leads with love, and it shows- from the early morning handshakes in the car line to the hugs he gives after school. Principal Humprey is the kind of leader we are privileged to have... and he is inspiring future school leaders every day with his example. #OurBoysNeedUs #SecuretheChalk #SCSis901

post_text:
Join the SCS team and support our partner Peer Power in the Big River Crossing Half Marathon and 5K! Peer Power is a non-profit organization that recruits and trains high-performing college students, called Success Coaches, to tutor in public school classrooms and mentor high school students to encourage active learning, valuing education, and being personally accountable for their futures.

Here's how to register (with discounts!):

1. Go to www.bigrivercrossing.raceroster.com
2. Register- You must enter email and create password.
3. Click the event you’d like to participate in
4. Complete the form and where it says "Add registration to a team", say yes and click on the drop down for Shelby County Schools.
5. At the bottom of the registration there is a field to add your promo code - $5 off the 5K - "SCS5K"
$10 off the half marathon - "SCSHalf"

#SCSis901
